comments.body: Basically, instead of calling find_cuda_config here, I'd create library cuda_config in cuda_configure.py that contains the exact same entries we've configured the build with. We can then depend on that py_library here, import it, and read the values as recorded during the repo configuration.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +62,66 @@    backup_argv = sys.argv
    sys.argv = libs
    cuda = find_cuda_config.find_cuda_config()

    build_info["cuda_version"] = cuda["cuda_version"]
